entry.title: Typing "new" quickly enough opens a new tab
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open e.g. https://doc.new 2. Type "new" into the doc 3. New tab opens
# Problem Description Typing "new" into some input elements unexpectedly opens a new tab. Sometimes it only works if it's typed super fast, sometimes it happens even if it takes me about a second to press the 3-key sequence. I could reproduce it in a private window as well as in keep.google.com or a Dropbox Paper.
# Summary Typing "new" quickly enough opens a new tab
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Document escalation path for Chrome ClusterFuzz issues
PageInsightsCoordinatorTest#testResizeContent is flaky
entry.content:
PageInsightsCoordinatorTest#testResizeContent is failing in step "chrome_public_unit_test_apk on Ubuntu-22.04" on builder "android-pie-x86-rel" (and others)
[Test history](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid%3Achrome_public_unit_test_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.page_insights.PageInsightsCoordinatorTest%23testResizeContent)
[First failing build]( https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/android-pie-x86-rel/20588/overview)
[Most likely culprit CL](https://crrev.com/c/5320904)
Error message: ``` java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<0.0> but was:<1704.0> at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:89) at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:835) at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:577) at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:701) at org.chromium.chrome.browser.page_insights.PageInsightsCoordinatorTest.hideTopBar(PageInsightsCoordinatorTest.java:315) at org.chromium.chrome.browser.page_insights.PageInsightsCoordinatorTest.testResizeContent(PageInsightsCoordinatorTest.java:407) ```
Post test screenshot attached

entry.title: Create a DelegatingLayoutManager
entry.content: Create a DelegatingLayoutManager which takes a delegate with a limited number of functions from LayoutManagerBase. Initially, only CalculateProposedLayout needs to be implemented. Keep the number of delegate functions to only what is needed for very simple, localized bespoke layout tasks. This would be used in place of overriding View::Layout() and would use the LayoutManagerBase ProposedLayout model.

entry.content:

# Problem Description The extension works for 10 years without a problem now is blocked.
# Additional Comments On other browser works fine.
# Summary Downloads extension stop working.
# Additional Data Category: Extensions / Themes \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Webview plays video at double speed when audio is enabled.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Set up a simple html page that includes a video (including controls) with sound. 2. Play it with sound, notice it is at double speed. 3. Use the video controls to mute the sound, notice it plays at normal speed.
# Problem Description Seems there is are multiple AAudio / AAudioStream logs into logcat per millisecond during video playback.
This is not happening with Webview version 84 but it happens with 114.
# Summary Webview plays video at double speed when audio is enabled.
# Custom Questions #### Does this work in other browsers?
Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Audio / Video \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Incorrect wrapping around floats
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open the example URL https://murakamishinyu.github.io/bugtest/chromebugs/float-test.html 2. Check the rendered result. # Problem Description ```
1234
1
123
123456
1
123
123456789

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ ``` There are 7 left floats with `clear: left`, and the text is wrapping around them. The problem appears at the 2nd and 3rd floats whose widths are smaller than the 4th float but the wrapping text is aligned as if the 2nd and 3rd floats are same width as the 4th float. This problem does not happen if the 4th float width is smaller than the 1st float or the 7th float width is smaller than or equal to the 4th float. # Additional Comments Attached a screenshot comparing Chrome, Firefox and Safari. Only Chrome has this problem. I tested several Chrome/Chromium versions, canary, beta, stable and some old versions (101 to the latest) and found that all have same problem. I'm having trouble with this strange float behavior in Chromium. I hope it will be fixed as soon as possible. # Summary Incorrect wrapping around floats # Custom Questions #### Example URL: https://murakamishinyu.github.io/bugtest/chromebugs/float-test.html #### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below #### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself #### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chromium problem # Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: autofill_server_browsertest.cc should use embedded HTTPS server
entry.content: autofill_server_browsertest.cc currently uses data URLs and the `kAutofillAllowNonHttpActivation` feature. We should migrate this to the embedded HTTPS server.

For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about:gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: "File Bug" should link to Chromium bug tracker
entry.content:
issues.chromium.org should preferred over b.corp.google.com for filing Chromium bugs: - it can be used with @chromium.org accounts - the list of components is restricted to Chromium components which - makes the search easier - ensures that a bug won't be filed to an internal Chrome component
issues.chromium.org supports the same URL query parameters as b.corp.google.com. The only problem I've seen is that I don't know how to modify the access level to "Limited Visibility + Google" by default. It [doesn't look like](https://g3doc.corp.google.com/company/teams/buganizer/user-guide/concepts/templates.md?cl=head#supported-query-parameters) it's supported as a query parameter.
Matthew, could you PTAL? Asking you as you was an author of https://crrev.com/c/5257039

entry.title: Pre-roll video not playing fully, just audio only.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Head to https://1655-655b7c21bb7f9.radiocms.com/player/ 2. Press the Play button 3. This triggers a video to play before the audio, but it only plays the audio from the video.
# Problem Description There is meant to be a pre-roll video playing before the audio starts, but sadly this does not work since the latest Chromium update. It plays the audio from the video, but not the video content. Please could you fix this? It works on Firefox and Safari.
# Summary Pre-roll video not playing fully, just audio only.
# Custom Questions #### Does this work in other browsers?
Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Audio / Video \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Create a separate infobar for the tab-sharing UI
entry.content:
The tab-sharing infobar has diverged from the ConfirmInfoBar to such an extent that reusing the ConfirmInfoBar implementation is no longer of any help, but more of a hindrance.
To prepare for future changes to the tab-sharing UI, a new TabSharingInfoBar should be created and the TabSharingInfoBarDelegate should inherit directly from the InfoBarDelegate instead of from the ConfirmInfoBarDelegate.

entry.title: Chrome version 122 font-family style using Unicode style is not effective, version 121 is effective
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. set font-famliy styleÔºö font-family: "\30D2\30E9\30AE\30CE\89D2\30B4\30B7\30C3\30AF", PingFang SC; 2.View the style of the fourth fontÔºö Âà©Áî®Ë¶èÁ¥Ñ 3. Chrome version 122 font-family style using '\30D2\30E9\30AE\30CE\89D2\30B4\30B7\30C3\30AF' does not work, version 121 is effective.
demoÔºö https://codepen.io/hejingtao/pen/JjVjEyp
# Problem Description
"\30D2\30E9\30AE\30CE\89D2\30B4\30B7\30C3\30AF" is a Unicode sequence representing the Japanese characters "„Éí„É©„ÇÆ„ÉéËßí„Ç¥„Ç∑„ÉÉ„ÇØ". In Chrome version 122, the font-family style using '\30D2\30E9\30AE\30CE\89D2\30B4\30B7\30C3\30AF' does not work, while in version 121 it is effective.
# Summary Chrome version 122 font-family style using Unicode style is not effective, version 121 is effective
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Print active probes on startup
inline browser doesn't work in config
headless=new hangs chrome process on some pages, tested on 1.22
entry.content:
Moving the report from https://github.com/GoogleChromeLabs/chrome-for-testing/issues/115 here:
> Chrome-for-testing 1.22 on Rocky 9, on the same machine is also installed standard chrome 1.22. > > I have found strange bug that will be probably very tricky to replicate. > > Our custom WWW intranet application (so I cannot provide public demonstration) hangs load when chrome-for-testing uses new headless commandline parameter --headless==new. The page is not loaded and even screenshot that I am creating in selenium after timeout exception displays empty white page. > > After command with headless=new the chrome process hangs with these warnings: > > ``` > ./chrome --dump-dom --headless=new '<URL>' > [1997052:1997068:0228/174750.050006:ERROR:bus.cc(407)] Failed to connect to the bus: Could not parse server address: Unknown address type (examples of valid types are "tcp" and on UNIX "unix") > [1997052:1997068:0228/174750.050358:ERROR:bus.cc(407)] Failed to connect to the bus: Could not parse server address: Unknown address type (examples of valid types are "tcp" and on UNIX "unix") > [1997052:1997068:0228/174750.050399:ERROR:bus.cc(407)] Failed to connect to the bus: Could not parse server address: Unknown address type (examples of valid types are "tcp" and on UNIX "unix") > [1997052:1997068:0228/174750.050451:ERROR:bus.cc(407)] Failed to connect to the bus: Could not parse server address: Unknown address type (examples of valid types are "tcp" and on UNIX "unix") > [1997052:1997052:0228/174750.053586:ERROR:policy_logger.cc(157)] :components/enterprise/browser/controller/chrome_browser_cloud_management_controller.cc(161) Cloud management controller initialization aborted as CBCM is not enabled. Please use the `--enable-chrome-browser-cloud-management` command line flag to enable it if you are not using the official Google Chrome build. > [1997052:1997068:0228/174750.062972:ERROR:bus.cc(407)] Failed to connect to the bus: Could not parse server address: Unknown address type (examples of valid types are "tcp" and on UNIX "unix") > [1997052:1997068:0228/174750.063055:ERROR:bus.cc(407)] Failed to connect to the bus: Could not parse server address: Unknown address type (examples of valid types are "tcp" and on UNIX "unix") > [1997115:7:0228/174750.183393:ERROR:command_buffer_proxy_impl.cc(131)] ContextResult::kTransientFailure: Failed to send GpuControl.CreateCommandBuffer. > INFO: Created TensorFlow Lite XNNPACK delegate for CPU. > WARNING: Attempting to use a delegate that only supports static-sized tensors with a graph that has dynamic-sized tensors (tensor#39 is a dynamic-sized tensor). > ``` > > If the headless=old is used, everything works well, the DOM is dumped as expected and chrome process exits. Without headless at all, the XWindow chrome is displayed and page is correctly loaded. > > Even in standard chrome 1.22 (not "for-testing" version) this command works well for both headless=new and headless=old variants. > > Yhe problem affects only chrome-for-testing and headless=new combination. > > I am using chrome-for testing for some selenium checks and the new variant is recommended in documentation. > > This problem occurs only on one particular intranet WWW application, othew WWW applications works well even with headless=new. > > There is output (without DOM dump) for headless=old > > ``` > ./chrome --headless=old '<URL>' > [0228/180217.578902:INFO:policy_logger.cc(145)] :components/policy/core/common/config_dir_policy_loader.cc(118) Skipping mandatory platform policies because no policy file was found at: /etc/opt/chrome_for_testing/policies/managed > [0228/180217.579080:INFO:policy_logger.cc(145)] :components/policy/core/common/config_dir_policy_loader.cc(118) Skipping recommended platform policies because no policy file was found at: /etc/opt/chrome_for_testing/policies/recommended > [0228/180217.586729:WARNING:bluez_dbus_manager.cc(248)] Floss manager not present, cannot set Floss enable/disable. > [0228/180217.697077:WARNING:sandbox_linux.cc(418)] InitializeSandbox() called with multiple threads in process gpu-process. > [0228/180217.704713:ERROR:command_buffer_proxy_impl.cc(131)] ContextResult::kTransientFailure: Failed to send GpuControl.CreateCommandBuffer. > ``` > > In this scenario the chrome process exits with returncode 0, instead of hanging.

entry.title: Kazakhstan timezone changes (Mar 1, 2024) are not reflected in Intl.DateTimeFormat (IANA 2024a)
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem console.log( new Intl.DateTimeFormat('en-GB', { dateStyle: 'full', timeStyle: 'long', timeZone: 'Asia/Almaty', }).format(new Date(Date.UTC(2024, 2, 1, 10, 0, 0, 0))), );
# Problem Description Kazakhstan will utilize single UTC+5 timezone https://www.timeanddate.com/news/time/kazakhstan-single-time-zone.html from March 1, 2024. The code above shows the UTC+6, which is incorrect. It should be UTC+5. It seems that latest changes of IANA 2024a are not applied.
# Additional Comments The timezone is correct in Firefox 124.0b3 and Safari 17.2.1
# Summary Kazakhstan timezone changes (Mar 1, 2024) are not reflected in Intl.DateTimeFormat (IANA 2024a)
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Canary \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Tab focuses on Invite though there is no functionality for it in Google Meet
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 124.0.6329.0¬†(Official Build)¬†canary¬†(arm64)¬† 8f83baf3936696a32b20875d9436b4829c44765b-refs/branch-heads/6329@{#1}
OS : Mac,Win(10,11),Linux
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and create any instant meet 2. Click on Add others 3. Tab focus in the pop-up that appears 4. Observe that tab focuses on Invite though it has no functionality either by hitting enter or clicking on it.
Actual Result: Tab focuses on Invite though it has no functionality
Expected Result: There must be no tab focus on Invite when it has no functionality
This issue exists from M-112 onwards .So, raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the screencast below:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CBMzthGa3lvM3CFWHQdgr6-snIxPrsux/view?usp=drive_link
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Beta #123.0.6312.4, Dev #124.0.6315.2 and Stable #122.0.6261.94 2)As this is a Non-Regression issue, changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.title: Realbox suggestions are still shown after clicking and typing in omnibox when default search engine is ‚Äòbing‚Äô
entry.content:
Chrome Version:124.0.6329.0¬†(Official Build)¬†canary¬†(arm64)¬† 8f83baf3936696a32b20875d9436b4829c44765b-refs/branch-heads/6329@{#1}
OS : Mac,Win(10,11),Linux
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and set default search engine as bing from chrome://settings/search 2. Open NTP 3. Click on real box to show suggestions 4. Click on omnibox and type something 5. Observe
Actual Result: Suggestions are shown both for omnibox and real box
Expected Result: Suggestions must be shown only for omnibox
This issue exists from M-112 onwards .So, raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the screencast below: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1tIbfSsu24kcV5yy6Y4wxV_m8l5cOBM-J/view?usp=drive_link
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Beta #123.0.6312.4, Dev #124.0.6315.2 and Stable #122.0.6261.94 2)As this is a Non-Regression issue, changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.title: Video frame quad is not opaque
entry.content:
We've enabled the hardware decoding on Linux Wayland with output format of AR24. However, the AR24 frame is marked as "not opaque" [1], causing we cannot promote it to overlays with the check here [2].
I think the Alpha channel should not be really used as we have opacity and blend mode in quad state to handle cases we need blending. So maybe video frames should be always opaque here [1]?
[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/graphics/video_frame_submitter.cc;l=836
[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/viz/service/display/overlay_strategy_fullscreen.cc;l=52

entry.title: CSS beautifier / pretty print breaks my styling
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 122.0.6261.71 OS Windows: 10
What steps will reproduce the problem? On load, the pretty print is active by default
What is the expected result? it should be disabled or an option in settings should be available to disable
What happens instead? please can it be disabled or allow me to disable it as this breaks my CSS formatting, there was an option to disable the automatic pretty print of code but this is infuriating. I constantly have to reformat my CSS, there are limitations on the bespoke CMS I use for my job in terms of how many lines of CSS I can have.

entry.title: TabSwitcherTabletTest#testEnterAndExitTabSwitcher is failing on builder "android-12l-x64-dbg-tests"
entry.content:
TabSwitcherTabletTest#testEnterAndExitTabSwitcher is failing in step "chrome_public_test_apk on Ubuntu-22.04" on builder "android-12l-x64-dbg-tests"
Builder: [android-12l-x64-dbg-tests](https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/android-12l-x64-dbg-tests)
First failing build: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/android-12l-x64-dbg-tests/15652
Error message ``` java.lang.AssertionError: OverviewLayout should be TabSwitcherAndStartSurfaceLayout layout at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:89) at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:42) at org.chromium.chrome.browser.tasks.tab_management.TabSwitcherTabletTest.testEnterAndExitTabSwitcher(TabSwitcherTabletTest.java:175) ```
I'm pretty sure that https://crrev.com/c/5332655 is a culprit CL.
Calder, could you PTAL?

entry.title: No e-mail notification to waterfall gardeners for failed rolls

[anraggar360] Can't switch to another account after adding it.
The instructions in Chromebook Help
entry.content:
# Feedback Report ID:
91560707096 [Listnr (internal link)](https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91560707096) [FeedbackMon (visible to partners)](https://crosbolt.chromeos.goog/feedback/91560707096)
# Feedback Description:
Can't switch to another account after adding it.
The instructions in Chromebook Help center say "select time -> select your google account email -> sign in another user"
However, when I click on the time, I see sound, brightness, wifi, etc. setting, the build number and work logo and word "Managed", but don't see any google account emails.
I tried clicking around in this pop up, found this feedback form, but still did not find the account switch/sign in.
It happened at ~2.20 pm.
I do see the second account in settings, but I cannot find a way to sign into it.
# Product Specific Data: * Chrome Version: 122.0.6223.0 * ChromeOS Release Version: 122.15732.0.0 * ChromeOS ARC Status: enabled * ChromeOS ARC Version: 11260658 * ChromeOS Release Track: DEV * ChromeOS Release Board: nissa * ChromeOS Release Keyset: mp-v14 * Kernel Version: 5.15.145-021388 * Firmware Version: Google_Anraggar.15217.425.0 * ChromeOS Release Model: nereid * Google Code Name: anraggar360 * HWID: [ANRAGGAR360-NTBE B2C-B2A-A2A-M6B-69Z](https://chromeos.google.com/partner/dlm/hwid/lookup?query=ANRAGGAR360-NTBE+B2C-B2A-A2A-M6B-69Z) * Submission Date: 2024-02-13 GMT * Enterprise Enrolled: Managed
